intro: Chrysanthemum obtusum, commonly known as the woolly chrysanthemum, is a species native to China and parts of East Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its fuzzy, grayish-green leaves and showy yellow to orange flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, adding vibrant color to gardens. Chrysanthemum obtusum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine.
